Meet the new addition to the Breckenridge FFA program, Brooke Diaz. Mrs. Diaz graduated from Texas Tech University where she majored in Agriculture Communications. She grew up in Weatherford, Texas exhibiting sheep at every major stock show in the state of Texas. Mrs. Diaz will be starting a wool judging team and taking over the supervision of the sheep/goat projects.

During Mrs. Diaz’s spare time you can find her at stock shows taking pictures as a livestock photographer. She also runs her own photography business on the side. Joining Mrs.Diaz in Breckenridge is her husband, Jacob, and their 5-month-old son, Kash. They also have two corgis named Rose and Lola that will be making the move to Breckenridge!

“I can not wait to meet all of the amazing members
of the Breckenridge FFA Chapter,” said Diaz.

This curriculum focuses on building a positive mindset within our administration, teachers and students. The idea is to promote a positive culture within our schools. It's not a secret that happy, positive people are more likely to reach their full potential. Our number one goal is always helping each student leave school with the best education they can receive, and this is another piece to building well-rounded citizens.

Each month students will learn a different mindset concept, with lessons taking between 15-20 minutes a week. Students at BHS will learn this lesson on "Mindset Monday".

The attached letter explains the program, and each month a new letter will be attached to this page. Strike up a conversation with your student about what they are learning.

Go Bucks!

Students in Kelly Grissom's physics classes have been in serious engineering mode of late. They are building and testing trebuchets or medieval catapults that require a lot of thinking, application, and problem solving. The official academic content involves projectile motion, utilizing skills of velocity, acceleration, and simple mechanics. There are three sizes: small, medium, and large. Ms. Grissom and company will soon conduct a competitive launch, so we will bring cameras and video gear to the event and keep you posted. Great work, Ms. Grissom & Students! Way to make academics less abstract and more hands-on and minds-on!
